terms.definition: The process of making software applications or documentation available for use by end users, often involving configuration and setup on target systems.
Customer Relationship Management - software systems used to manage interactions and relationships with customers and potential customers.
Software as a Service - a cloud computing model where software applications are delivered over the internet on a subscription basis.
A centralized repository of information, documentation, and resources that provides answers to common questions and solutions to problems.
A sequence of connected steps or processes that define how work moves from initiation to completion in a systematic manner.
The process of connecting different software systems, tools, or platforms so they can work together and share data seamlessly.
A foundational software system that provides the infrastructure and tools for building, deploying, and managing applications or services.
A point of interaction between different software components, systems, or between users and software applications.
The use of technology to perform tasks or processes with minimal human intervention, reducing manual effort and errors.
Written materials that explain how software works, including user guides, technical specifications, and help resources.
Electronic commerce - the buying and selling of goods or services over the internet through digital platforms.
The volume of users, requests, or data flowing through a website, application, or network system at any given time.
The visual and stylistic elements that represent a company's identity, including colors, logos, fonts, and overall design aesthetic.
A period when a website or web application becomes unavailable to users due to technical failures or maintenance issues.
Software applications designed to help teams plan, organize, track, and manage projects and tasks efficiently.
